TrustExpression: TIP_1 AND TIP_2 AND TD_1 AND TD_2 AND TD_3
Description: This Trust Interoperability Profile specifies NIST 800-63 LOA 3 requirements on the management of authentication tokens and credentials by CSPs, as adopted by FICAM. This Profile does not the include security control requirements stated in NIST 800-63. Credential storage requirements from NIST 800-63 are not covered in this TIP, but are covered in the NIST 800-63 Token Type Specific Strength and Authentication Profiles, specifically for shared secret tokens.

TrustInteroperabilityProfileReferences.Name: NIST 800-63 Credential Verification Profile for all LOAs
TrustInteroperabilityProfileReferences.Description: This Trust Interoperability Profile specifies NIST 800-63 requirements on credential verification services provided by CSPs, for LOAs 1 - 4.

TrustInteroperabilityProfileReferences.Name: NIST 800-63 LOA 3 Renewal and Re-Issuance Profile
TrustInteroperabilityProfileReferences.Description: This Trust Interoperability Profile specifies NIST 800-63 LOA 3 requirements on the renewal and re-issuance of tokens and credentials by CSPs.

TrustmarkDefinitionReference.Name: Revocation of Tokens and Credentials Within 24 Hours
TrustmarkDefinitionReference.Description: This Trustmark Definition covers requirements on Credential Service Providers (CSPs) for the revocation of tokens and credentials within 24 hours of a CSP becoming notified of a compromise.

TrustmarkDefinitionReference.Name: Token and Credential Provenance Record Retention
TrustmarkDefinitionReference.Description: This Trustmark Definition covers requirements on Credential Service Providers (CSPs) for maintaining token and credential provenance records.

TrustmarkDefinitionReference.Name: Token and Credential Provenance Record Retention for Seven Years and Six Months
TrustmarkDefinitionReference.Description: This Trustmark Definition covers requirements on Credential Service Providers (CSPs) for retaining token and credential provenance records for seven years and six months.
